intro: Piloselloides hirsuta, commonly known as hairy sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and its leaves are often covered in fine, hairy textures. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Piloselloides hirsuta is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
